question:
A company is running a legacy system on an Amazon EC2 instance. The application code cannot be modified, and the system cannot run on more than one instance. A solutions architect must design a resilient solution that can improve the recovery time for the system.

What should the solutions architect recommend to meet these requirements?

options.A: Enable termination protection for the EC2 instance.
options.B: Configure the EC2 instance for Multi-AZ deployment.
options.C: Create an Amazon CloudWatch alarm to recover the EC2 instance in case of failure.
options.D: Launch the EC2 instance with two Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes that use RAID configurations for storage redundancy.

explanation: CloudWatch alarm actions can automatically recover an EC2 instance when a system status check fails. This is ideal for single-instance legacy applications that cannot be modified. The instance is recovered with the same instance ID, IP address, Elastic IP, EBS volume attachments, and instance metadata.
